trial_identification.studytitle: Effectiveness of a titratable mandibular advancement splint for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnoea
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of a titratable mandibular advancement splint to reduce the apnoea hypopnoea index in the treatment of obstructive sleep apnoea

interventions.interventions: Intervention group: Titratable mandibular advancement splint (a dental device that advances the mandible (lower jaw)and is used during sleep) for obstructive sleep apnoea with objective feedback on effectiveness at 3 weeks, final follow up at 6 weeks.
interventions.comparator: Control group, Titratable mandibular advancement splint for obstructive sleep apnoea with no feedback at 3 weeks, final follow up at 6 weeks.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 3 weeks (active group), 6 weeks (active and control group).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Apnoea hypopnoea index 10-40/hour on diagnostic sleep study, two symptoms of obstructive sleep apnoea, body mass index < 32kg/m2, minimum of 8 teeth, ability to protude the mandible by at least 6mm.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Exaggerated gag reflex, tempero-mandibular joint disease, presence of additional sleep disorder, significant co-morbidity.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation was done by removing from a closed box 'objective' or 'subjective'. The person recruiting the subjects did not have access to allocation.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation. Sequence is generated by randomly removing each allocation from closed box containing equal number (20) of the two intervention options.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Christine Groves, research administrator Wellington School of Medicine

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Obstructive sleep apnoea can be treated using a mandibular advancement dental device. This study will look at the effectiveness of an adjustable device on sleep apnoea severity and whether objective feedback to subjects about its effectiveness results in adjustment and better effectiveness compared to adjustment without objective feedback.
